rpc.model
Class OraclePC

java.lang.Object
  rpc.model.OraclePC

public class OraclePC
extends java.lang.Object

The Oracle PC algorithm for learning partially directed causal models of relational domains. The oracle consists of two separate phases: skeleton identification and edge orientation. However, the oracle is given the true model so that perfect information about the dependencies and conditional independencies are given to the edge orientation phase. This is useful to ascertain upper bounds on recall for orienting edges. The oracle does not access the database.

          Initializes the Oracle PC object.

          The first phase identifies the skeleton by taking the true causal model and rendering each edge as undirected.
 void orientEdges(boolean withREM)
          Run Phase II of Oracle PC to orient edges that are consistent with the true patterns of association and conditional independencies encoded by the true model.
 void orientEdgesOrder()
          Runs the edge orientation rules in a pre-specified order to orient edges that are consistent with the true patterns of association and conditional independencies encoded by the true model.

Constructor Detail

OraclePC

public OraclePC(ModelSupport modelSupport,
                Model trueModel)
Initializes the Oracle PC object.

Parameters:
modelSupport - data structure containing set of all units, dependencies, and potential causes.
trueModel - the true model containing the true dependencies.
Method Detail

identifySkeleton

public void identifySkeleton()
The first phase identifies the skeleton by taking the true causal model and rendering each edge as undirected.

getModel

public Model getModel()
Get the current version of the learned model.

Returns:
the currently learned model.

orientEdges

public void orientEdges(boolean withREM)
Run Phase II of Oracle PC to orient edges that are consistent with the true patterns of association and conditional independencies encoded by the true model.

orientEdgesOrder

public void orientEdgesOrder()
Runs the edge orientation rules in a pre-specified order to orient edges that are consistent with the true patterns of association and conditional independencies encoded by the true model. Call attachRule() method in the order desired before running orientEdgesOrder().

attachRule

public void attachRule(java.lang.String eoClassName)
Attaches an edge orientation rule to be used to orient the model in the specified attaching order.

Parameters:
eoClassName - the class name for an edge orientation rule (e.g., aiq.model.edgeorientation.ColliderDetection).
